Course Description: THIS COURSE PROVIDES THE STUDENT WITH AN INTRODUCTION TO ACCOUNTING PRINCIPLES, PRACTICES AND REPORTING
Objectives / Learning Outcome(s) / Major:
1. UNDERSTAND THE USES OF ACCOUNTING AS AN INFORMATION SYSTEM IN BUSINESS
2. UNDERSTAND WHAT AN ADJUSTMENT IS AND HOW TO MAKE AN ADJUSTMENT
3. UNDERSTAND KEY TERMS (CASH, RECEIVABLES, INVENTORY, ASSETS, AND LIABILITIES)
4. UNDERSTAND THE COMPLETION OF THE ACCOUNTING CYCLE
Textbook(s):
ACCOUNTING, CHAPTERS 1-13, 26TH ED
AUTHORS:  CARL S. WARREN; JAMES M. REEVE; JONATHAN DUCHAC 
CENGAGE LEARNING: ISBN-13:  978-1-305-08841-2
Transfer Status: GUARANTEED TRANSFER TO INSTITUTION OFFERING SAME COURSE.
